column4: no idea for: how to force modprobe to load a specific driver although vendor/productid does not fit?
modprobe sisusbvga works, but it doesn't seem to run on the right device...
You cant use a kernel module that doesn't specifically support your device
You can load the module but it just wont work
it does, but it has not all productids+vendors inside...
the modprobe modname works without -f, too, but it does not understand which physical device it belongs to.
If this is the case that the module is designed such that it only operates with valid product/vender IDs, then you should use the patch
so there is no way to do it - just for testing - before recompiling all the patch?
Try modinfo $MODULE to see the options available for said module
:-( it will take for hours to get the X devels which are required to compile this driver. i will go on searching for modprobe tricks.
Use modinfo to see the options available to the module you're working with
modinfo returns a lot and also knows the 0x0711 already: http://nopaste.info/ecf1742905.html
I think there is a reason for the patch and you should use it unless it's really old and already made it's way into the kernel
the patch is really only rewriting the compatibility list. no other changes at all.
Takes seconds to compile a kernel module usually
